website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind a few minor annoyances, the Nyko Charge Station is a great way to recharge your Wii remotes.
pros: Affordable battery charging station for two Wii remotes
rubberized battery covers add much-needed grip
charging dock is a handy place to store your Wii remotes
cons: Can't use Wii remote sleeves with it
may not provide enough juice for marathon game sessions
not the most attractive piece of gear

customer_reviews.title: A Must For Multiple Wii Stations In The Home
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to accompany the Wii systems we have both in the living room and in my home gym. The charging stations work just fine, (when we remember to put them in their stations at night.) We have not had any issues with them at all. You can charge 2 Wii remotes simultaneously, there are two rechargeable NiMH battery packs; LED Charge Indicator lights, Dual port rapid recharging dock and a six foot power cable, and a charging dock. Dual injected rubberized and textured battery covers are comfortable to hold onto. 2 NiMH rechargeable batteries. You can see when batteries are done charging with two LED indicator lights.
customer_reviews.author: NW Granny

customer_reviews.title: No Good
customer_reviews.text: Received the product, removed it from packaging. Installed the new batteries in my controllers, plugged the charging station in and set the controllers into the station. The blue lights came on, after some time of charging the lights changed to green indicating they were charged. I then proceeded to try to use the controllers. neither one worked. I then put AA batteries into the controllers so I could play the WII. So basically I spent $39.00 dollars for nothing. I would return the items but had to destroy the packaging to open.
customer_reviews.author: Dsteele

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: This is a replacement for the exact same product we were using after years of use when the rechargeable batteries finally wore out. This works just as great as our old one and we couldn't be happier that we can use our WII again! We will always buy this brand as long as it's available. Yes, you have to make sure the controller is making connection with the base when charging (make sure the light comes on), but it's not hard to do. It really is a great product!
customer_reviews.author: Amber L. Tenorio

customer_reviews.title: A junk charging station with poor rechargeable batteries
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as it would save money on battery, I was wrong. A few weeks after getting it, one battery pack just stopped holding a charge and would only show one bar of power left if it did try to recharge. About 3-4 months after that the other one stopped working and would just die after a minute of use. Not only that, they were a pain to get to charge, as the controllers would have to be in precise position to charge. Do yourself a favor and look at regular rechargeable batteries. You'll be better off on avoiding headaches with this junk.
customer_reviews.author: tangytangerine

customer_reviews.title: These are great and save a lot of money not having to ...
customer_reviews.text: These are great and save a lot of money not having to buy batteries. I have had one for almost 3 years and they still hold a good charge allowing around 2 - 3 hours of playtime per charge. I bought this one recently for my other controllers and like them. The only complaint is that sometimes it is difficult to position the controllers so that the charging light comes on. However I have found that the controllers will charge even when the light is not on. You just have to make sure there is a good connection.
customer_reviews.author: z9834

customer_reviews.title: SAVING ME MONEY
customer_reviews.text: I love this battery charging dock for Wii Controllers and only wish I purchased one sooner. I've gone through boxes of AA batteries for my controllers, and am so happy that I probably won't need to buy another battery again. Upon receipt of this charging dock, I changed out the batteries of my two controllers and placed on the dock. Immediately, the LED light turned on to show that the controller was charging. In about 30 minutes, the blue light turned green confirming that it was fully charged. It's so quick, easy, and stress-free! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Affordable and it works
customer_reviews.text: This charging station is working just fine for us, and it was less expensive than several others I looked at. This is the second Nyko charging station we've have, and the first one lasted several years until one of my rough housing kids damaged the wires on the back of the charger and the remotes couldn't get a connection and charge. We'll be more careful with this one. It's a little tricky to maneuver the wrist straps on the remotes into a position so the base of the remote can sit in the charger. Just make sure you see the blue lights on the charger so you'll know the remotes are actually charging, and you should be good to go.
customer_reviews.author: SG

customer_reviews.title: Wii Control Charger
customer_reviews.text: I'm glad I have the charger. It saves on battery purchases when the system is getting a lot of use, which mine does. When not in use, it isn't a good idea to leave indefinitely on the charger, I think it weakens the battery life. For infrequent periods of use, usually outdoor summertime playtime, I switch to batteries. Only sure thing must do when using the charger is have it securely flat so the devices sit in properly. If you have the motion controls or rubber, non-slip grips, you do have to remove them to properly set the controllers to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Lily Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Not bad if you want longer battery life for a low price.
customer_reviews.text: Battery lasts quite a bit. The box promises 20 hours, but I haven't actually measured it, and it may not be counting Wii Motion Plus games. I don't really like the fact that you need their special slot cover, but it's not horrible. It's possible to charge without taking off the strap, but it may wobble a bit. Otherwise it's annoying having to take it off. The LEDs are very bright, you won't want to charge during the night.
customer_reviews.author: carlosfer2201

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the Wii!
customer_reviews.text: If you have a Wii, you should really get one of these charging stations, otherwise you'll spend a small fortune in batteries. A couple of thing I had questions about before I bought this unit which I will answer here: 1. two batteries are included with the pack 2. the batteries are not too big on the wiimote--the mote still fits into all peripherals (we have the zapper, wii wheels) 3. you can buy extra batteries for other wiimotes 4. the unit doesn't get hot, and is about as tall as the actually Wii. 5. charges last through a couple of days of moderate game play (1-2 hours daily) So go and get charging!
customer_reviews.author: B. A. Chaney

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Nice features: plugs into wall, not USB port in Wii. Batteries and covers fit reasonably well. Not so nice feature: Wii says battery down to half capacity after only 1 hour of gaming Comparison: I previously bought the cheapest charger I could find on Ebay. The remotes were in the charger for weeks, never reaching a full charge. The batteries did not fit well. Conclusion: This was worth the slightly higher cost, while I cannot confirm exactly how long the battery will last (is Wii accurate?) we have not had an issue with capacity that could't be resolved by doing something else. So far they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer #375

customer_reviews.title: Batteries don't last very long
customer_reviews.text: The charger works well once the Wii-mote is seated properly. You have to move the wrist strap out of the way. The batteries worked well at first, but you really have to make sure that they don't charge too long and that they charge fully before you use them...In other words the batteries that come with the chargers are the issue here. They've run their life and now we have two charging stations that are of no use because we're back to using AA batteries.
customer_reviews.author: jako

customer_reviews.title: works great even after years of use...no more batteries
customer_reviews.text: This is a great charging station. I haven't bought batteries in years. Workswith the Nyko Wand for Wii (reviewed those as well) and it also works with the original remotes that come with the wii. It charges the remotes fast and keeps them carged when not in use, so they are ready when you want to play. It has an indicator light on the front of the device to light up different colors when charging vs charged. Each holder has its own indicator light. I am now using it with the wii u and still works perfectly. I have had this product for several years.
customer_reviews.author: ravens.grlTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Lasts
customer_reviews.text: Purchased in 2008. Still working in 2020. Batteries don’t last as long but it’s been what, over ten years.
customer_reviews.author: KB

customer_reviews.title: This is a must own accessory for the Nintendo Wii
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this when I bought the Nintendo Wii for my kids. This is a set of rechargeable batteries and a charging base for two Nintendo Wiimote controllers. We have never used any other battery in the Wiimotes, these have worked perfectly from day one. It took a couple of hours to charge the controllers initially, but my kids have never run the batteries all the way down. They know to put the controllers away when they are done playing by placing them in the base station. That keeps them charged up and put away. A win all the way around.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Miller

customer_reviews.title: Quality & design that you would think that Nintendo themselves made it!
customer_reviews.text: As many other reviewers have said, if you have a Wii, then you know that the batteries in your remote don't last very long. Nintendo should've made something like this and sold it as a package deal with the system. This charger is great, it really does its job so well that you expect that it was made by Nintendo. I'm very impressed with Nyko's quality and design of how it matches the Wii so well. I've had my charger for years and purchased this one as a gift for my in-laws.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Timpanaro

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I purchase one of these when I got the Wii a few years back. We expanded to 4 controllers so I got another one. They both work great! Don't bother with the ones that run off the USB port on the Wii as you will quickly learn that they will not charge when the Wii is not turned on (like my mother learned..lol). These have their own power cord and charge till the battery is full and turn off by themselves. These are great. You can even buy new batteries for it if you ever need to and they are sold local if you have a best buy about.
customer_reviews.author: redhairsunshine

customer_reviews.title: I have already purchased again and don't think you would be disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace the batteries for the unit I purchased years ago. The cost was so high that it was only a coupe of dollars more to purchase a new unit with the batteries. I have been using for years now, and have experienced little to no problem. I have already purchased again and don't think you would be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: IBMrT

customer_reviews.title: The batteries are worthless
customer_reviews.text: I bought these and don't really use them. Only one battery keeps a charge, and that's only for 2 hours. It's cool to see the pretty blue light, but other than that these are in the back of a closet taking up space. I never play Wii but bought these thinking i would. If i played a lot i would hate these more than i hate Apple, but lucky for these, i don't. If you're looking for a cheap alternative to the store prices, look elsewhere. These are filled with failure and get charged with disappointment!
customer_reviews.author: adzeisler

customer_reviews.title: So convenient!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great companion to the Wii. The Wiimote is a battery eater and this eliminates that problem. It's so nice to be able to play a game for as long as you like without having to worry about wearing down the batteries. This keeps the Wiimotes completely charged and ready to go! I don't understand why so many of the reviewers here have had issues with the wrist strap being a problem. We have had no problem at all with that. If you simply move the strap to the side of the remote it makes connection just fine. Not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: jrjccj

customer_reviews.title: Incompatibility
customer_reviews.text: While our family has not had much time to test the durability and reliability of the battery packs, I quickly noted that the charger base/batteries are completely incompatible with Nintendo branded charger bases/batteries. The contacts are a completely different style on both parts and in completely different locations - be prepared to have two Wii remotes dedicated to using Nyko batteries with the Nyko charger; otherwise, you are constantly changing between Nyko and Nintendo batteries, etc. In the grand scheme of things, maybe not that big a deal...just a minor headache.
customer_reviews.author: Gr8Scotts

customer_reviews.title: Has worked for a long time, shows no signs of breaking or slowing down
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this charging station. The battery packs don't add any bulk to your controllers at all, they fit snug the way the normal wii battery covers do. In addition, they have a nice rubber backing to them which makes gripping the wiimote much easier. The charging station itself works perfectly, allowing me to keep two remotes full charged at all times. The batteries fill up quickly and last for a long time. Overall highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: A. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: This dock works great! The batteries and the cover itself will fit your Wii controller perfectly. I would love that this dock had 4 charging stations instead of just 2, because battery life is not quite the best...but even with this minor "defect", you can enjoy at least a minimum of 6 hour continuous game play with no issue at all (I once lasted 8 hours playing Guitar Hero World Tour with my friends using 2 guitars, the mic and the drum set).
customer_reviews.author: Phreak777

customer_reviews.title: Good Job and Compact
customer_reviews.text: I've had this about a year now - it does a good job of saving me money with recharging the batteris, and the light indicator tells you if it is charging and changes color when the charge is complete. The only drawback I have is with the wrist straps on the hand held units - they get in the way of immediately placing the units on the charger and have to be placed "exactly" right or the unit won't charge; that took some getting used to but doesn't detract from the value of the charging station.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Great charging dock/batteries? For a month at least.
customer_reviews.text: Must have for wii and wii-u owners. The batteries last a hella lone time, it charges quickly and is aesthetically pleasing to boot. *edit* A mont in one battery stopped taking charge and a week or so ago charger stopped charging. Can't rightly give anything more than a 1 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Devon

customer_reviews.title: Little resistant
customer_reviews.text: It will damage the months one of the charging pin, is little resistant. the other works well.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Penaloza

customer_reviews.title: Love it, Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: The base charger is great. The best part is the battery case grips, because of the rubber edges, not one of my friends has "accidently" hit the TV with the Wii controller, or flung it into the wall. No problems in that department. Now, "accidental" elbow jabs in the arm -- that's a different story. Also, there's a place to put the Wii controllers after your done playing. The lights aren't really that bright. I mean, it's in the living room so no problem, and no different than the other glowing lights in the entertainment cabinet.
customer_reviews.author: c.Lake

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality Charger - Stay Away
customer_reviews.text: I originally purchased this charger on March 27, 2010. By mid-June it had stopped working. Both cradles would turn green indicating that the remotes were charged when they were not. Amazon replaced my defective charger with a new one and already (now mid September), one of the cradles has stopped working. I contacted Nyko and they told me to send them my defective product - at my expense - and that it will take 2 - 3 weeks for them to send me a new one. Absolutely horrible! I am fed up with products made by this company. I'm simply going to replace the product with something more durable from a more reputable company.
customer_reviews.author: D. Paul

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work with the younger crowd.
customer_reviews.text: We were so tired of going through batteries over summer vacations that we had to try something. When we could get it to work it worked. It was hard for our son to properly place them in there to get them to charge right. After two years of off and on use, the batteries just stopped working. In retrospect I would have bought some kind of rechargeable batteries that I could use with multiple devices instead of having yet another single item electronic device that I have to dispose of.
customer_reviews.author: 253matthews

customer_reviews.title: but like, it doesn't easily click into place
customer_reviews.text: ok this worked alright, but like, it doesn't easily click into place, ya know? so like. you kinda have to be careful and put it into place /just so/ in order for it to charge? yeah, point off for that otherwise, ok yeah, fine knock off brand
customer_reviews.author: Hannah B.

customer_reviews.title: This Charging Station WORKS!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Wii charging station I've purchased - the reviews were outstanding -- and they were right -- it really works. Item comes with two rechargable battery packs (with rubber on the back of the pack - makes a great gripe). And the best part - it charges even with the wrist strap attached (just put the strap off to the side in the bay). The 1st unit I purchased (different vendor, different model) wouldn't charge the batteries - tossed it!
customer_reviews.author: The Networking Guy

customer_reviews.title: Works like the original
customer_reviews.text: This charging system works very well. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Hatfield

customer_reviews.title: Waste of my money.
customer_reviews.text: Would give it a zero if I could. One battery does not charge ( even when I try to charge it on my other charging station that came with my Wii) and one side of the charging station does not charge unless u push and hold the remote to it or tape the remote tightly against it. Waste of money. Will use regular batteries instead.
customer_reviews.author: Jazmine

customer_reviews.title: If the controllers would only leap in the cradle...
customer_reviews.text: This works very well, it is a LITTLE fussy when placing them in the cradle and the add on 'sensor' cannot be on the controller while charging, nor can the rubber sleeve, which discourages the use of both. The LED lights fully indicate if you have it right and it charges quite quickly. We have been using ours for a few months now and see not degradation in the batteries as of yet. 09/2011: The batteries are still holding good full charge. this is a GOOD DEAL.
customer_reviews.author: YsLadyMN

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For 20 bucks you really can't beat it. I've been using it for almost two years now, and it's worked with one exception. About 6 months ago one of the charging prongs on the charger broke off so I couldn't use the left charger. The right one still works though. I would be careful when setting your remotes in the cradle, since putting them in too hard might cause the prongs to break.
customer_reviews.author: taxidriver1138

customer_reviews.title: Great investment! Save money on batteries!
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Nyko charging station, which is a GOOD thing. We purchased our first about 5-6 years ago. The batteries have lasted that long! Great performance and easy to use, I highly recommend this. The only reason I bought a new station and batteries, is because it was about the same price as buying the batteries by themselves. Nothing is wrong with our first charging station, but now we have an extra. Sure saves a lot of money on batteries.
customer_reviews.author: momok

customer_reviews.title: A must have item
customer_reviews.text: This is a life saver! We knew the WII remotes drained regular batteries quickly, but we didn't realize exactly how quickly. This kit contains the 2 rechargeable batteries for the 2 remotes that come with the WII system. We bought an extra remote which does not come with the rechargeable battery pack, so it uses regular AA batteries. Needless to say, the AA batteries never last long so we rarely use the third remote. The WII Charger works fantastically and the battery pack holds a longer charge as well.
customer_reviews.author: ChiTown's Finest

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: For the record, I don't have the rubber cover over my Wii controllers. All I have is the strap that is attached to the bottom of the controller. It's not difficult to place the controller onto the charging station. Just make sure the strap is to the left or right of the controller when you plop it down. Then gravity takes its course and the back of the controller touches the metal charging section of the charger. Seems to hold the charge pretty well. I've had this product for about 2 months.
customer_reviews.author: TN

customer_reviews.title: Works as expected. Soft green LED when fully charged.
customer_reviews.text: I upgraded to this after getting burned by a cheaper model (not sold by Amazon any more). The previous model I'm talking about (made by HDE) had a glaring LED and the batteries did not hold a charge longer than 30 minutes. This one on the other hand hold a charge for a long time, and the LED turns a soft green when fully charged (not glaring). Also, it has a higher quality look than the HDE model.
customer_reviews.author: Justin F. Penner

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use, and functional.
customer_reviews.text: You just need to replace the batteries and battery cover on the Wiimote with the ones included with this (two battery packs and two replacement covers), and you're done. Set it in the station to charge it (there's no latch or anything, it's contact charge), the light turns green when it's fully-charged (blue while charging). The replacement covers, in additiona to having the contact holes, also have some rubber-type grip on them, which is nice since a bulky Wiimote cover will stop the Wiimotes from fitting in the dock.
customer_reviews.author: George Gates

customer_reviews.title: Update
customer_reviews.text: This is much easier to charge my remotes than the other one I have. Very easy to tell if it is in the charger right and it is charging. Also when it's fully charged. Keeps a charge a long time. Update, Product just stopped working don't understand why. Makes me mad since the window for return ended June 1st. Purchased May 1st. It is July 8th and it no longer works. That is just awful.
customer_reviews.author: Nanc

customer_reviews.title: Good Product for the Wii
customer_reviews.text: We had purchased a Wii handset charging system from a local videogame store and it worked fine for about a year or so but then the batteries quit charging. So, we looked to Amazon and found this higher-rated unit and thought we'd give it a try. We're happy we did because it worked right out of the box and seems to have been doing well for the past couple of months we've used it. The 1 year mark will tell the tale though.
customer_reviews.author: F. Cirksena

customer_reviews.title: Charges quickly and lasts about the same.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in April and am not having luck with any of my six Wii remotes. It charges very quickly yet leaves just as fast. I am not happy with them. It's been this way pretty much since I bought the charging station but have been crazy busy and unable to return them. Now I am too late.
customer_reviews.author: H. McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Stop Wasting money on Batteries
customer_reviews.text: My goodness, with all the use my kids give the Wii remotes I have been buying batteries left and right. This solves that problem. Easy rechargeable batteries, they go in quick, recharge quick and last a while. Just make sure you push the straps over so that the remotes can charge when sitting in the cradle. They only bad thing is you have to take the silicon gripper for the controllers to recharge the batteries.
customer_reviews.author: MWJII

customer_reviews.title: Great product with few flaws
customer_reviews.text: works great but there are a few problems, the wrist straps have no place to sit so more often then not you have to spend a few seconds trying to actually get them into the slot. the only other problem is you cant buy expansion packs where it has 2 more covers and battery packs without having to buy another charge kits... works great and charges fast i like the covers more then the standard Wii battery covers. overall a must have for any serious Wii player..
customer_reviews.author: David Rouleau

customer_reviews.title: the new batteries do not charge!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the Nyko Wii Charge Station and nothing seems to works, batteries don't charge and I'm not sure wether it's the charger or the batteries. Back it goes!
customer_reviews.author: Rick and Claudia

customer_reviews.title: As good as original equipment
customer_reviews.text: I bought this charger and batteries several months ago to replace our original Wii equipment and I am so pleased to find that it is as good as the original charger. It charges two remotes very quickly. I need two more batteries to replace some others and will definitely be buying from the same company.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: Great Charge Station
customer_reviews.text: I have had this unit for almost two months and have had no problem with it. My family mostly plays the dance/fitness games--Michael Jackson, Just Dance 1 & 2, and Gold's Gym. I got tired of replacing the batteries. With this unit, I have no more waste. I also love that it was priced under $18. I have seen the same unit at our local Best Buy for a lot more. I am so glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: n2Dzine

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper to get rechargeables & a charger....
customer_reviews.text: It's a nice idea, being able to dock the wii-motes have them charge, but the battery packs stop holding a charge after a couple of years and it's not worth replacing them. We have another brand of this device that has lasted longer, but I imagine that its days are numbered as well. Was nice while it lasted and did NOT damage our wii-motes as some reviews have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Vatis

customer_reviews.title: Great way to save batteries
customer_reviews.text: I would give this a 5-star review because it fits the controllers and looks natural... however one of my two controllers continuously reads that it is 2/3 bars when first brought off the charger. Also one of the dock-ports is finicky and I have to wiggle the controller a bit before it reads that it is on it.
customer_reviews.author: Trosdan

customer_reviews.title: Wish it was for 4
customer_reviews.text: I like this and it serves it's purpose. It is tricky to place the remotes on correctly, but the light tells you it's in right. It charges great, and the charge lasts, we keep at least one remote on most all the time, because we are die hard netflix users. The charge lasts about a day to 2 days, so i'm happy. I just wish the quad charger was easier to find
customer_reviews.author: G. Murray

customer_reviews.title: Dependable, reliable!  Great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace my old set, and this is exactly what I had before. The previous set lasted about 5 years, and I am looking forward to this lasting just as long! I highly recommend this brand. You won't be disappointed! Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Ft. Stafford

customer_reviews.title: If you have the first Wii, Must Have
customer_reviews.text: Hard to find, happy I did. You should take the controllers off the charger for periods of time and let them run down, or else they will lose power due to battery "memory effect".
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Great utility for the Wii
customer_reviews.text: I was waiting for someone to come out with this - I had no interest wasting batteries or dealing with the standard AA rechargeable battery units. This all-in-one device is convenient and works as advertised (I have no problems mounting it for charge like some people, it's pretty straight forward). The added bonus is that the replacement backing of the controllers has a rubberized grip; which I find more comfortable playing with.
customer_reviews.author: Brady J. Frey

customer_reviews.title: Must Have!
customer_reviews.text: I love the wii charge station! My kids would go through so many batteries that I swore I was paying for the Wii sytem all over again. But once I got the charge station we were all in heaven. This gadget comes with rechargable batteries and all you do is put them in your remotes and sit them on the station to recharge. That's all there is to it...no more money thrown away in batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Izquierdo

customer_reviews.title: 5 Years and Counting
customer_reviews.text: We have had these charging stations for over 5 years now and they are still working just as well as the day we got them. They have discolored a bit (yellowing) over time but in some ways that can be expected for any product that has white plastic. I will definitely be buy thins this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: CaliGirl

customer_reviews.title: After limited use both battery packs are dead
customer_reviews.text: We do not use our Wii often, so the wiimotes spend most of their time on the charger. This worked well for a short time, but after a few months of non-use we found that both the battery packs were completely dead. We cannot even turn on the Wiimotes. This product was a waste of money. We will be switching to regular rechargeables now.
customer_reviews.author: DieselDM

customer_reviews.title: One of the battery packs charged fine while the other worked for 10 minutes but wouldn't ...
customer_reviews.text: DOA. One of the battery packs charged fine while the other worked for 10 minutes but wouldn't charge up. Tried switchnin ports on the docking station and still nothing. Didn't even bother to try customer service with some of the other reviews I read.
customer_reviews.author: g1ddy

customer_reviews.title: Love this item
customer_reviews.text: No more hunting around for spare batteries--this solves the problem of the battery-hungry wiimotes! The only thing I don't like is that I can't use the rubber wiimote covers with this, b/c the charger is in the back of them, not the bottom. That's a small inconvenience considering that these babies are always fully charged, which is key now that we have Netflix streaming!
customer_reviews.author: Pookapuff

customer_reviews.title: Has lasted for years!
customer_reviews.text: I don't use my Wii much anymore, but this charging setup STILL WORKS, 7 years later. I had other ones before that lasted less than a year. Highly recommend this one if you're in the market.
customer_reviews.author: New England Male

customer_reviews.title: fantastic money saver
customer_reviews.text: I would HIGHLY recommend this product to ANYONE that has a Wii. It has saved us countless battery replacement. I cannot even quantify how much money it has saved us. It is very useful. When the Wii remote is low on batter power, you just set it on the stand and wait for the light to change colors and BAM, you're ready to go!
customer_reviews.author: Bonnie K. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Way better than batteries!
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a year now, and it is still working! Granted, the rechargeable batteries do not last near as long and the charging station also seems to inaccurately report the remotes are charged fully when I had just put them on 10 minutes ago. But still, this has saved me dozens of AA batteries and it's still not hard to just charge one remote while using the other and switch between the two.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Very good charging station.
customer_reviews.text: I am very glad i bought this product.. it works very well and holds a charge longer.. unlike other third party batteries which are usually terrible. it fits very nicely into the wiimote and does not make its use uncomfortable or inconvenient. overall it does what it was designed to do and does it very well.. have not tested the length of the battery charge yet though.
customer_reviews.author: Alex Rogers

customer_reviews.title: I've had other brands that worked better. I had to remove the back battery pack
customer_reviews.text: I've had other brands that worked better. I had to remove the back battery pack, then carefully set it in just the right place to get it to work. Then after 6 months, one slot after another quit charging. I threw it away.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Great product! No more batteries to buy!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this charger for 1yr+ and have had no problems with it. The batteries recharge quickly and the charge lasts a long time. I haven't had to buy and discard regular batteries which is good for the environment and saves $$$. The only downside: the skin has to be partially removed to enable charging but I don't know of a charger that works with the skin in place.
customer_reviews.author: mj

customer_reviews.title: nice price
customer_reviews.text: i always appreciate the Amazon reviews. It helps me to make a wise decision. Although our WII is new and have not needed to replace the batteries, I thought this would be good to have. I am not disappointed. Easy to use and you can see at a glance that your controller has recharged itself. Only wish they had one of this for the Roomba because their chargers suck.
customer_reviews.author: sushicatlover

customer_reviews.title: Works great arrived on time no complaints for this product or ...
customer_reviews.text: Works great arrived on time no complaints for this product or the seller. Highly recommend them if you have one of the older Wii's like I do this is great to have we have two of them because we have 4 remotes to charge.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Klinkerfuss

customer_reviews.title: Charger didn't charge
customer_reviews.text: Took forever to get it, when it did arrive the charger would not charge. The batteries, (which is what we really needed), worked fine in our old charger. Couldn't return it, because you have to destroy the packaging to get it out. Will not order from there again.
customer_reviews.author: Creekside Music

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I love how I don't need to keep on wasting batteries on the wii remotes and it works well. Sometimes you have to jiggle it in the charge station until it connects, and let it charge for a while. The one I got said it was fully charged after about 5 minutes of charging. I'd wait 15-20 minutes or so to use it. It holds charge very well and can last a few hours of play like any wii remote with batteries. You don't need to buy new remotes, they just give you rechargeable batteries and a new back and you're set.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole Marmol

customer_reviews.title: Very Good But......
customer_reviews.text: This is a good idea. Very simple to use but.... It's a pain to put the rubber covers on and off so I don't You have to take the straps off and on, which I do. This is a minor pain but I think that a small clip would do the trick when they redesign the wiimote. The instruction booklet was in multiple languages, but nothing in English!
customer_reviews.author: Shastastan

customer_reviews.title: Still going strong
customer_reviews.text: I bought the charging station four years ago. The batteries don't hold a charge quite as long as they used to, but they still last for several hours. It can sometimes be difficult to get the controllers to fit so that they land properly against the contact points, but that's really my only complaint. This turned out to be a good investment.
customer_reviews.author: D. Chapman

customer_reviews.title: Better than Original Dock
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace the original charger that came with my Wii console. The original broke when I used a different wall adapter to plug it in (the cord is a seperate piece which we lost). This one has the cord permanently attached which is great and the remotes fit perfect on the dock unlike the original.
customer_reviews.author: Tspot

customer_reviews.title: Great company, great Charge Station for Nintendo Wii
customer_reviews.text: Had experience with Nyko brand charger stations and batteries before and I knew I wanted to charger station and batteries. I was not disappointed and you won't be either.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Lepkowski

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Little Charger
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as advertised, super easy, doesn't take up a lot of space. We've been using for a few months now without a single problem.
customer_reviews.author: LeiLa R Bryant

customer_reviews.title: This is my second one I gave the other I had to my nephew
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one I gave the other one I had to my nephew, assuming that I would be able to use the wii controller without it, I was wrong, you get used to the controller being charged all the time and not having to connect the USB cable every time. I am very satisfied with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lex Cardentey

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product, but connectors not perfect
customer_reviews.text: This is a must-have product for the Wii, so that you don't have to store piles of batteries at home. The only issue I have is that the connectors are great, and you have to align the remote perfectly when putting it back into the cradle, otherwise they won't charge. If you just place it in the cradle fast without making sure the blue light is lit, it won't charge. Cheers.
customer_reviews.author: Objective Guide

customer_reviews.title: It would only charge one remote at a time, ...
customer_reviews.text: It would only charge one remote at a time, also it would show that a remote was charged but when you went to use it it was dead. After about 2 months it stopped working completely.
customer_reviews.author: VMitchell

customer_reviews.title: Nice Idea
customer_reviews.text: This is better than replacing batteries all the time. The only negative is the silicone sleeve over the remote has to be taken off to fit in the charger and then it rarely gets put back on. It would be nice if it all fit on the charger. With all that WII is capable of, they could have designed this product better.
customer_reviews.author: Mother of two

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: This charge station is great. We were constantly having to replace batteries in our wii remotes. I purchased this charger and we love it. We're not hard core gamers but do play almost every day for at least 30 minutes. We've had this product about 1 month and only charged remotes twice. We don't put them on it every day to prevent over charging but when the batteries start to look low, we stick them on when we're done playing. Works great!!!
customer_reviews.author: Momof3

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: This was the smartest buy I've made for the Wii in my house. I felt like I was constantly changing the batteries in the remotes before, now I just leave them charging and never have to worry about a remote dying in the middle of a game. I have only 2 remotes (for two of us in the house) so this was great for us.
customer_reviews.author: Beth Mckinney

customer_reviews.title: Right charger. Right price.
customer_reviews.text: Not a lot to tell you here. This product is reliable, easy to use, safe, and enhances the Wii experience with a long battery life and extra controller grip. It's also only $16 at time of purchase. Excellent ratings make this an obvious choice over other brands, especially Psyclone. Our Psyclone charger was hot to the touch and died in less than one year. We kept it unplugged unless in use.
customer_reviews.author: spanky

customer_reviews.title: Great item - worked out of the box once charged
customer_reviews.text: Great item - worked out of the box once charged!! If having troubles with your remotes... try their reset button inside the back of the remote - along with inside your wii box!!!
customer_reviews.author: Jeanna1516

customer_reviews.title: Can't complain
customer_reviews.text: I saw the negative reviews on this charger but thought for the price I would give it a try anyway. It's been a month and so far no problems. The only down side I could find was that you have to pull the back cover off the remote to get it to fit in a Zapper. An inconveniance but not a deal killer.
customer_reviews.author: fyrefiter

customer_reviews.title: Best upgrade for the Wii
customer_reviews.text: PRO: Best upgrade for the Wii. CON: One set of batteries has sort of died after two years. OTHER: Charge lights are really bright, so if you have them in a bedroom and want to go to sleep, good luck, they are like spotlights in the the night!
customer_reviews.author: Blaydese

customer_reviews.title: love it.
customer_reviews.text: Love this... you just toss the remote back on the cradle when you're done playing! You always have fresh controllers! Fits well in everything I've used it with - Mario Cart (wheel), Guitar Hero guitars.. Cabela's Big Game Hunter (shotgun). Saves a bunch of money on batteries!
customer_reviews.author: hammieo

customer_reviews.title: It worked great for 7 months but now is just stopped charging ...
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for 7 months but now is just stopped charging the remotes. Frustrating. There's no reason it shouldn't work still.
customer_reviews.author: Tara Long

customer_reviews.title: poorly made
customer_reviews.text: This is a great item in theory, but almost immediately after opening and using the first time, the prongs that stick out of the charger base broke on one side, leaving us with only one usable charging side. Definitely not worth the money
customer_reviews.author: Green Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: so far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about 2 months now and there are no problems. I gave it 5 stars but MAYBE I could have given it 4.5. I say this because in-order to charge it correctly it takes about 10 seconds to position the controller on the charger. Other than that, it's a great product. EDit: It's been 1 year now. I still use it!
customer_reviews.author: K.o.

customer_reviews.title: Will not stay sycned
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I purchased this charging station and battery packs I have had nothing but problems with my wii. They charging station charges the batteries, but the remotes will not stay synched with the WII. I can't even get them to resynch with the system. It's a pain to have to spend 30 plus minutes trying to get the remotes to turn on. All they do is continually blink. It's a problem with all of the remotes that have this battery pack on them. Now I will have to replace them all once again. Don't waste your money on this product. Spend a little more and get a good brand.
customer_reviews.author: Adrienne

customer_reviews.title: wow....5 minutes was all it took.................
customer_reviews.text: ....to realize these are a P.O.S.!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Got home just now to find these on my doorstep. I was excited. I opened the box, opened both chargers, plugged them into the wall, put Wii remotes in the cradles, and 2 minutes later all blue lights turned to green!!! It literally took me 5 minutes to do all of that and these worthless chargers went from blue leds (means charging in progress) to green leds (meaning fully charged) in 2 minutes???? I messed with them for 5 minutes trying to get em to stay blue and actually charge the dead batteries.................NOPE...worthless chargers (or batteries)????. After looking at mostly positive reviews I figured i'd take a chance on these. SHAME ON ME!!!
customer_reviews.author: RAPR

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: A charge station is a must-have for Wii owners. I didn't give this item 4 stars because you have to remove the straps to charge the remotes. We purchased one of these a few years ago and ruined it trying to place the remotes on the stand with the straps attached. Other than that, no problems.
customer_reviews.author: S. Hodgson

customer_reviews.title: Not fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: This was great while it lasted, which was about 6 months. It just simply died one day.
customer_reviews.author: JVL

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to charge our Wii paddles on and it's been perfectly adequate. The charge seems to last a long time and it doesn't take forever to charge. I like the lights that show you when it's charging. Does it's job!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Have had it for so long and still works perfectly, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Working as expected.
customer_reviews.text: Had a different version for 4 yrs and needed new one. So far, everything is working well. Charge holds for a good amount of time.
customer_reviews.author: James T.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect if you are tired of switching out AA batteries in your Wii-Motes, the batteries are awesome and the charge cradle is amazing. This is a must have for the Nintendo Wii and for the Wii U.
customer_reviews.author: A.J.

customer_reviews.title: May take a few tries, but works perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I notice a lot of reviewers are saying that this product only charges for a few minutes before claiming it's fully charged, and then the battery only lasting a minute or so afterward. I had this same experience, but after a few more tries, it finally stayed blue and charged for a full 2-3 hours, and the batteries last a LONG time (I played about 2 hours of Metroid Prime Trilogy, and it still showed as having 4/4 bars left on the Wii remote menu). I haven't had any issues since. Definitely worth the price, especially to save much more on batteries in the long run!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas

customer_reviews.title: Wii Charge Station
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought the wii remote chargers because having to buy batteries ever so often is such a hassle. So far the charger is working great! The only thing I have to note about it is in the instructions it says that when the remote is not on the charger the light indicator is red. This is not the case with our charger. It doesn't show any color at all. The only lights that are displayed are blue (charging) and green (charged). If you don't like buying batteries for your controllers then I suggest this product.
customer_reviews.author: F-35 Mechanic

customer_reviews.title: plugs into outlet good option
customer_reviews.text: I bought this one which plugs into the outlet which is great no more batteries to buy, I also bought a 4 charger not paying attention and it plugs into the wi station which if the wi is not on it is not being charged BAD. So this one is a great charger option.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Am reviewing the charging station, only!
customer_reviews.text: I'm sort of at a head-scratching moment about this review! I don't play games but DO use streaming videos and have to recharge my controllers. This dual re-charge station gets the job done in a hurry! YIPPEE!!
customer_reviews.author: Quilter Sammy

product_meta.title: Nyko Wii Charge Station
product_meta.description: Edition:StandardEasily charge and store your Wii Remotes with Nyko’s Charge Station for Wii. The Charge Station includes 2 NiMH batteries, exclusively designed for the Wii Remote, each providing up to 25 hours of play time. Each battery is easily recharged by placing the Wii Remote in the charging dock. The charging dock conveniently plugs into any standard wall outlet, allowing for rapid recharging of both batteries in 8 hours. The Charge Station includes 2 custom battery covers with contact pass-through points so you can charge the batteries while they are still in the remote. Each battery cover is also rubberized for superior grip during intense gaming sessions. The Charge Station matches the décor and styling of the Wii, and is small enough to fit in any home entertainment center.
feature_bullets: Easily store 2 Wii remotes in any home theater with the small and stylish charging dock
Dual injected rubberized and textured battery covers provide a safe and comfortable grip
2 NiMH rechargeable batteries provide up to 25 hours of play time
Easily see when batteries are done charging with 2 LED indictor lights

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars1,051 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
specifications.Pricing: The strikethrough price is the List Price. Savings represents a discount off the List Price.
